Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the negative reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kate M
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last minute as attending a conference at Kensington Olympia. We saw the reviews after booking and were terrified about what we would find on arrival. Although it was a 15 min walk from Earls Court tube, it was easy to find and only two mins from Olympia. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly. The room was spotless we even checked for bedbugs after reading previous reviews! It was perfect for a short and cheap stay in central London. The bathroom was beautifully clean and the shower looked brand new. There were three of us in a triple room and it was very small but this is to be expected in a hotel of its size and price. The breakfast room is incredibly cramped and the food simple but again in this location for the price it was adequate. A good value hotel clean and friendly. Please don't be put off by previous reviews as I think major renovations have taken place since they were posted! Ps there are remote controls, irons and hairdryers available just ask the lovely receptionist who is more than happy to help!

Reviews.Title: “BAD HOTEL IN LONDON ( PESSIMO HOTEL A LONDRA)!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: moira d
Reviews.Content: I have been in London plenty of times but.... this was a very annoying experience. 1) They say 10 minutes from the tube but it is at least 20 if you don't run. 2) We asked 2 separate beds but they seemed army cots always trembling when turning during the sleep. 3)Where is the tv remote control ? 3) Toilet was incredibly small: no electrical outlet to dry hair 4) Light was very very low 5) Synthetic flooring was either horrible to see either very noisy while walking. 5b) The pillows in the pillowcase wardrobe were dirty, torn and withou the pillowcases. 6) Forget english breakfast in a romantic room!!!! You 'll have a continental breakfast in a very claustrophobic tiny room under groudfloor. No windows. Two strange women are stayng in a corner looking at you. They don't speak to you, they don't explain to you. If 2 guests want to help themselves there is no place enough not even to "follow the queue". Oh I have to tell you that if you are shorter than 164 cm you need a ladder to pick a cup or a plate up there! Besides as the owners probably thought that 9 square meter are enough to let 18 guest have comfortably their healthy breakfast they had the nice idea to stack some old frames in a corner behind a chair. 7) They write you can pay with credit card but if you don't pay cash they charge you 3% extra. 8) You have to ask for the received of your bill. 9) If you have to make the check in of your airplain and you can't find an internat point forget a help from the clerks!! A very kind hairdresser not far from the hotel very kindly helped me but not the staff. 10) As a conclusion: when you work in a simple hotel with an old structure you have to balance the problems with a warm, good, helpful staff. Nothing to do!!!!!!!!! I won't go back in that horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: RWilson
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quite out of the way and difficult to get to. The reception staff as previously mentioned do not speak fluent english. The rooms were fine. Size just about adequate as we were only staying one night. View from window looked out onto a poorly kept garden filled with rubbish which could have been made into a lovely terrace.... Bed was ok. Coffee making facilities were very poor and the coffee was the worst I'd ever tasted. Bathroom was tiny but modern and clean. Shower was hot and clean. No hand soap provided, had to use the sachet of shampoo instead. Breakfast was served in a very very small room in the basement, barely enough room to squeeze between tables and I am not a big person. The breakfast room had no natural light and no ventiliation so was boiling hot coz of the toaster machine. Breakfast was just the bare minimum, basic toast and jam. And there was cereals. There was not enough cutlery, I had to spread my toast using the back of the spoon my mum had eaten her cereal with.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: Yemm
Reviews.Content: The shower was dirty, the sheets were dirty. My room had a severe leak when it rained the water ran over my light fitting, the staff were terrible, the beds are all broken, didn't even bother to try the food, the window didn't shut. DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “If you like being verbally abused stay here”
Reviews.Author: wehay2003
Reviews.Content: DISGUSTING FILTHY THREATING MEMBER OF STAFF!!! wehn i arrived it was smelly and work was taking place on the stairway wires all over the place my room the cover had hairs on the bed and the floor is just wooden really dreary no fire warning sign on back of room door you had to squeeze past wardrobe to get into bathroom and tv was high above with no remote when i complained i was threatend with an aggressive attitude and said if i dont like it i could get out and no refund what a disgrace AVOID i have and will report on this hotel further

Reviews.Title: “What's wrong?”
Reviews.Author: cunamara44
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights recently.It's undergoing refurbishment at the moment and this obviously causes a little inconvenience.However, the staff were very helpful and I had a lovely room, very clean and bright. I paid £2 for the wifi but for some reason it didn't work properly but the guy on reception refunded my money with no quibbles at all.The breakfast is a continental one,lots of bread, cheese, jam tea, coffee, orange juice, corn flakes, all in all no less that you'd get in a 5 star hotel.All in all great value for money in a good location. Donnachadh Ó Mórdha

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay - Do not book this Hotel/Hovel”
Reviews.Author: Lov3Travel
Reviews.Content: We booked base on the website info/photos - but what a big mistake! Were forced to pay for our entire stay up front straight away - not the usual policy we would expect!? Rooms were dirty and cramped, far too hot, A/C not working, bad fire exits (unsigned and narrow) and ladders and tools left in the hallways by workmen who were everywhere and creating dust and more dirt all around the hotel. Moody unhelpful staff. Walls are paper thin and we had to listen to all the goings on of the rooms and floor around us at all hours of the night - which was not much fun. Not only this but some of my personal items (clothing) went missing from my room...and was given no explanation by staff. Terrible experience and I know these reviews often state "the worst place I have ever stayed" - but in this case I that is the reality of it. We will never return and would warn other not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: isabel_pereira
Reviews.Content: really bad hotel, the worst I've ever stayed in in London. Would never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Carol B
Reviews.Content: Not only was the double bed, 2 camp beds pulled together, the threat of neck ache because the TV was on the ceiling, was never a problem as it did not work. Ability to addrress a complaint zero. Sad

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Dank....”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked judging by the pictures on their site... what a mistake.. Mouldy room, Mouldy bathroom, Horrible curtains hiding the cracked windows, Musty Cigarette smell, Disgusting carpet, disease ridden, yellow stained 1970's appliances. Empty hotel... says a lot

Reviews.Title: “Awful, didn't know these places could still legally exist.”
Reviews.Author: hankhill23
Reviews.Content: Chap on Reception was very friendly, that probably made all the difference. Overall it's old, shabby, cramped, and cold. Filthy Windows, crap in the hallways. Very basic breakfast in a cramped basement. We booked rooms that were shown on booking.com as reduced from nearly £300 down to £85, but there's no way they would ever be that kind of money, so that's a blatant scam. They charge an extra 3% to pay by credit card (and insist on payment up front). I don't know which rooms are the ones shown in the official photos, but neither me nor my two colleagues had rooms anywhere near as nice, see photos. Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful.”
Reviews.Author: MissJJE
Reviews.Content: This place is not good. It's in an expensive area, and is relatively cheap, but the walls are mouldy, the bathrooms smell awful of mould - the windows are rotten, the carpets are dirty, the blankets on the bed are soiled, the TVs are from the 1980s, and there's not room to swing a cat. It's the kind of place you imagine you might catch bedbugs.

Reviews.Title: “what a craphole”
Reviews.Author: jonrose
Reviews.Content: We had to stay here for work in a twin room, luckily it was two twin beds put together so we moved them apart, The hallways were hazardous with wires sticking out of them, big bags of concrete on the landings, no carpet in some areas and bits of floorboards sticking up we had to jump over and that's before we got to the room. The room was clean but had no TV (as advertised) the aircon didn't work (it was a warm night) and the shower just leaked all over the floor outside the shower. There were tea & coffee making facilities but missing the essential kettle to make them with. The breakfast was cereal or toast with slabs of old cheese and hard boiled eggs served in a windowless basement cupboard. We were cleared out the room by a rude Spanish girl 15 minutes before breakfast was finished. When we went to reception and asked why there was no Kettle in the room, the rude receptionist just looked at us like we were in the wrong.. "you should have told us" well no my friend.. you should have put a BEEPing KETTLE IN OUR ROOM! I actually agree with a lot of other comments, worst hotel ive EVER stayed in and yes, a major fire hazard, get this place closed down or at least remove all of those stars!

Reviews.Title: “3 star - can't be knocked down quick enough”
Reviews.Author: kirk385
Reviews.Content: in September 1st 2011 I was out having a small sherry or two in town...... long story short I missed my train and used late rooms to find this £60 double bed for 1 night. Reviews said clean and friendly etc..... the staff must have written them! I booked in over the web, got to the hotel at 12.30am for the 1 night. They put the price up £15 claiming the last £60 room had just been taken..... I went to the room and found it to be filthy. I am no back packer or snob but honestly, spiders, cobwebs and a damp smell like you wouldn't believe. No mini bar (my focus was water), no milk or cups but a kettle.... I slept in this damp, cold greif hole but upon waking I found mold alongside the bed, over the pillows and parts of the wall, nice! Thirsty I went to the shower room, no soap, 1 sachet of shampoo and so on. I climbed into the shower and and switched it on, the shower hose metal thing where the water comes out exploded, hurtling the object into my forehead.... shower cancelled. Dressed, I called and asked reception to order a taxi for me to work. They stated I should hail one outside and hung up! It took 20 mintutes to hail a taxi outside the hotel while I coughed up the mold. In short this hotel was awefull and cant be knocked down quick enough.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't think that places like this existed anymore”
Reviews.Author: Irishtourist99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip this week. My company were really struggling to find us accomodation as London was really busy so this was all they could get. I have never seen anything quite like it. It was on a filthy, badly lit street, and all the neighbouring buildings were in really poor repair. Myself and my colleague had 2 rooms on the 2nd floor. Hers had 5 beds along a wall with prison type coloured blankets on the beds. The light fittings were melted, there were holes and cracks in the wall, and there was an overpowering smell of damp and mildew. We decided to see if mine was any better and needless to say there wasn't much improvement. Again the wall were cracked, damp, water stained and filthy. The beds were like fold away holiday cots. The curtains were hanging off the window and the bathroom was filthy and covered in mould all over the tiles. The view from the window was of a filthy back yard with rubbish strewn all over it. We returned to reception and asked for other rooms but we were told there were none available. Luckily as 2 female colleagues, we were able to share my slightly less revolting room as the only option we had. However as a female travelling alone, I would feel this hotel apart from its appalling standards was unsafe to stay in alone. My company were charged an extortionate rate for the rooms which was another disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, revolting, suitable for sewer rats”
Reviews.Author: KIzzy J
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I came to London for a special birthday. Unfortunately this hotel runied this for so many reasons: Dirty Cobwebs all over room, Curtains hanging by a thread, Draw holding window open, Sweat box with no working air conditioning, Sink was blocked, Breakfast covered in flys, Rude staff, And just to top this experience off in the morning the toilet leaked water all over the floor, Apparently according to the staff we still paid a good price for this experience £110 to stay in a glorified hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad Points”
Reviews.Author: toxgryph
Reviews.Content: The good points include a really nicely redone bathroom, a great price, and a good location. Really close to a decently convenient tube station and not much more than a 10 minute walk from some really convenient tube station. As others have said, the breakfast room is tiny and the offerings are pretty limited. The beds were also pretty thin and didn't offer a great sleep. Two out of three desk staff members were great but one was terribly rude. She sat right outside our room smoking, resulting in our room reeking of smoke. It wasn't just a one shot deal either, it happened multiple times.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in a dustbin”
Reviews.Author: Ajbanger77
Reviews.Content: Ok im going to list good points and bad points. Good points: The pillows were clean. Bad points: (brace yourself). Staff rude and not helpful Staff didn't speak english Breakfast room was the size of a cheap swimming pool cubicle. Toaster went on fire. No smoke alarms. Hair dryer sounded like a two-stroke motor that blew up. Shower turned off when you moved an inch. I hit my head off the light going down the stairs. The view was of dustbins and stepladders. Cement bags were acctualey left outside the door. The carpet was stained and mouldy. The tv was tiny, only 2 channels worked and was to high. Mouldy ceilings and holes in wall. BEd BuGS!!! The room took five small steps to walk across. The three single beds were about 3 inches apart. Shower was stained and mouldy. No hot water to after 7 30am. Corridors were the width of a mineshaft. Sinks were like a tea cup. Milk was out of date. Fungus in tea cups. No tea bags. One sachet of out of date freeze dried coffee. Staff toilets had urine up the walls. Continental breakfast was muesili, warm milk, cornflakes, butter that you actually had to pour on bread, no egg cups, had to bash egg of the table, no windows, about three tables and no cutlery. Overall absolute rubbish and should be shut down and burnt.

Reviews.Title: “Meh....”
Reviews.Author: Chooksaway
Reviews.Content: Had no problems with staff, as others have reported - however, room was very small and badly laid out - it was as twin and you had to squeeze past one bed to get to the other, and the bathroom was the size of a broom cupboard. Ours was I think one of the rooms everyone says is nicer, in the basement, and with a big window looking into a scruffy backyard/garden. The whole basement was very stuffy and claustrophobic - goodness knows what we would have done to escape had there been a fire - smash the window I suppose? beds/linen seemed spotlessly clean, but carpet had seen better days. Beds seemed to be like foldaway type, not proper single beds, and were a bit wobbly (but mattresses seemed clean and were comfy enough. Breakfast next day was a joke. A small airless, windowless room had too many tables crammed in, and a tiny corner alcove had do-it-yourself toast machine, drinks, a plate a flabby processed cheese slices and a bowl of tepid hard boiled eggs. People were shuffling round, trying not to bump into each other and trying to figure how things worked. Very poor. It felt like the whole hotel had just tried to cram as many rooms into the building as possible, without regard for comfort or safety. Good point was that the hotel is just a couple minutes walk from Kensington Olympia station or ten mins to Kensington high street. In my opinion, not a disaster, but overpriced and pushing their luck.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in uk, possibly world”
Reviews.Author: MrHreviews
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference at Olympia. Work paid for the room, which unfortunately meant I could not change once I had arrived, believe me I would have been gone in a flash otherwise. Firstly the man who checked us in was extremely rude and was dressed in a t-shirt and jeans. His grasp of English was not great and he was very aggressive towards my colleague. Once we were given our rooms I was shocked to discover that my double room was actually twin beds pushed together. The bathroom had mould and the paint was peeling of the ceiling. Being on the ground floor I was also delighted that my window had no lock on it. The hairdryer was a fire hazard and the TV was bracketed to the highest point of the ceiling without a remote control. Don't bother complaining to front desk as they just laughed at me. DO NOT STAY HERE, PAY THE EXTRA TO STAY AT THE PREMIER INN ROUND THE CORNER! It's not worth the saving you make

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed really gone downhill since last visit.”
Reviews.Author: oliverPenzance
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times in the past and it was good.But boy has it gone downhill what a shame as it is so convenient for Olympia Exhibitions..Staying here for four nights two nights in still waiting for a kettle to appear in room despite numerous requests.Staff in general don't give a dam.Will be staying elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER STAYED IN ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD”
Reviews.Author: beewhit
Reviews.Content: Had to pay before saw room. Can understand why as it was terrible. Holes in wall where a trouser press had obviously been. Further holes in wall where tv bracket had been moved. Mould on walls and window and little flies on the mould. Couldn't use the shower as covered in mould all over, especially the shower head which was caked with black fungus and rust. The only good things to say is that the towels and bed linen were very clean, although the beds very, very small. When you turned over, you nearly fell out. They were more like temporary put you ups.

Reviews.Title: “GO ANYWHERE ELSE BUT HERE”
Reviews.Author: RJSCBerkshire
Reviews.Content: The worst thing for me about this place was that I brought my CEO here, I doubt if he will ever forgive me. There is not one single thing I can say that would redeem this place other than suggest closure. For those that stayed here you have my sympathy.For those that are about to book - remember that there are thousands of better hotels in London - some cost less, some cost more but I doubt if any could be worse. Judging by the majority of comments from others you have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: dstevens84
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms at the hotel, one was in the basement and to be honest was not that bad, new bathroom and windows and I can see perhaps that this is where the ok reviews come from. However, go up to the 1st or 2nd floor and it is a very different story. Holes in the ceiling, mould, strange fishy smells, dirty towels, rotten windows that do not close, filthy stained walls, peeling paint. We could not bring ourselves to eat there in the morning so cannot tell you what breakfast was like. It is a shame that you can go halfway round the world to Thailand and pay £3 a night for a room which may be basic but is at least clean, whereas here you pay £65 for a room that to be honest, you should not stay in unless you have an up to date tetanus vaccination.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: ahlane1968
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel without reading the reviews on here, just from the hotel booking web site. When we did read the trip adviser reviews we were worried, all set to cancel but we took the chance. It was fine, we had a new room in the basement. Small room, only a queen size bed and compact shower room. No mould, and plenty clean enough, which was my main concern. Plus's.... Close to Olympia station so tube travel was easy, clean fresh towels, continental breakfast if required, air con in room, good value for money. Minus's..... Small, our room was by the breakfast room so little noisey, no parking.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: bennyc1985
Reviews.Content: First impressions was of a nice fair priced hotel.photos on internet were lovely and the outside was beautiful with flags flying,reception apeard glamorous and inviting.then it all changed.the receptionist could be described as lazy,slow and casual at best and rude and obtuse att worst.greeted with the word "what?" The door was not held open for us as he walked through it without a backwards glance.decor was shabby and hotel had a strange burning smell lingering over it.our room was tiny,the mini bar was empty except for out of date UHT milk.the tv was at least twenty years old.cracks in walls and ceiling, wires hanging from walls coverd in holes.windows didnt close,room card had to be removed to turn lights off,toilet tiny and dirty,shower mouldy and damp.iron cord freyd with wires hanging out dangerously,ironing board bent,beds apeared clean but by the time it came to using them I felt dirty,itchy and wrong.the cleaner I bumped into whilst trying to find the so called restraunt though with very little english was the politest member of staff I spoke to.a disgusting,shabby,unclean dump of a hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel and very overprised”
Reviews.Author: Charl17
Reviews.Content: Previously (4 times) I stayed at the Holland court hotel (this is about 1½ years ago)..now there is a new owner.and the place is in such a state. The bathroom and part of the TINY DOBBLE BED ROOM was covered in fungus and the room was overall dirt. I really do not understand how the hotel health and safety inspectors allows this hotel to remain open...... The breakfast room is like a shoe box, (no windows and very small and hot), with only a limited continental breakfast. (previously full English was in cluded, and the breakfast room was bigger with a wiew out to a garden). The aircon was broken, making a terrible noice even when switshed off, a light bulb and remote control was missing and was never replaced although I mentioned this twice to the manager. We were unable to switch off the light without removing the room key from the eletricity charger, the aircon thought keep on making a noice. The price for the hotel was much more expensive that previously, Need I say we left before time and stayed in a really lovely 4 star hotel for £ 25 less.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional staff and a terrible standard”
Reviews.Author: Rvr123
Reviews.Content: Me and a couple of my friends stayed at the Holland Court for a couple of days. We stayed at a double room each of us, and we payed exactly the same price. We were greeted by a very unfriendly lady in the reception, who looked like she was about to fall asleep. When we got to our rooms, we noticed that one of my friends had a newly refurbished room, with a flat screen and a minibar and the other friend had got a room with gorgeous paintings and lovely decorated. When I got to my room, there were cracks in the walls, and the toilet seat had burn marks on it, while the mini bar was empty. When we got back from a night out we caught the receptionist sitting in the sofa in the reception eating ordered pizza and talking to his friends. Be aware that you can hear everything that happens in the hallway and in the other rooms from your room. I found it hard to even sleep. On the positive side, my bed was very comfortable, and a hair dryer was left in your room. Would on the other hand consider staying at a hostel, next time I am traveling to London on a budget. You should seriously consider it too!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the False Photos Depicting this Nightmare Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beethoven123
Reviews.Content: We were in London on business. Our general manager made the reservation for us at this hotel, going by the reasonable price and Internet photos that depict a decent place. Lies. The photos are complete and unadulterated lies. Unlike the picture, our room was old and dilapidated, and no bigger than a walk-in closet. The sheet didn't even cover the entire mattress, only the top. The room didn't resemble, in any way, the size or look of the online photo. The bathroom was moldy, old and decrepit, and the toilet didn't flush. The lift didn't work (And the one employee who was there didn't offer to help), so we had to lug our suitcases up 2 flights of stairs. Among the amenities listed online is 24 Concierge. I don't think so. I would question all of items listed. They way it looks on the Internet, the Holland Court Hotel is a quaint, inviting and attractive place to stay, with a lovely garden in the back. Don't believe it. This is the Hell Hole Hotel. And what was worse, when we informed them that we would not be staying the 3 nights, only one, we were offered only 1 night's credit, not the two for which we weren't there. Stay anywhere else in London but the Holland Court Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Its cheap for a reason”
Reviews.Author: Dunners1
Reviews.Content: Great location, get off the train and your there before you know it. Just off Kensington High Street and 5 mins from Olympia. Room 107 was too warm and the window was screwed shut so had to put air con on. Bathroom had mould on ceiling and around the bath. The top of the toilet system popped up every time you flushed. Lift was not working. Breakfast room has been done up but its cramped. Carpet in room was dirty. Bed seemed to be a fold up type. Pillows need to be folded in half to get any substance to them. The hair dryer overheated due to the amount of dust in the fan filter. For a one night stay it was ok but dont expect too much from this place. Its 2* not 3*. £65 for the night (30/10/10)

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in London, maybe the world.”
Reviews.Author: CAChapman
Reviews.Content: I stayed this week at the Holland Court Hotel and have never stayed in a hotel that is quite so awful (and I've stayed at 50p a night hotels in India). The bathroom was disgusting. The shower was covered in black mold and barely usable. The toilet didn't flush and the worst part was the sink plug was blocked so the first time it was used to wash hands it then had a sink of stagnant water. Despite reporting this to the front desk who assured us it would be fixed while we were out in the evening it never was, and was completely unusable. The rooms were tiny and dirty with carpet that didn't go to the edge of the rooms. The coffee and tea making facilities were dirty and the beds were uncomfortable and tiny. My colleague had a equally poor room with a fold out bed and more black mold in the bathroom than we had if that is even possible. If I had any other option I would have checked out and moved hotels. However as there are very few hotels close to Kensington Olympia I presume this hotel gets regular business. It should be closed down. Do not stay at this hotel under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “I paid £57 for one night with breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: TouringMoo
Reviews.Content: I paid £57 for one night with breakfast. This is budget accommodation! Don't expect too much. Good points : clean bed sheets, clean towels, working tv, clean bathroom,hot shower, serve yourself breakfast - toast, cereal, cheese and boiled eggs all reasonable. Bad points : damp, mouldy patches on Walls , musty smell , tatty decor, sink slow to drain, no soap, bit noisy at night. I wouldn't stay here again and I wouldn't recommend it but judging by the other reviews I either got off quite lightly or they have slightly cleaned up their act!

Reviews.Title: “Shut it down”
Reviews.Author: Seafenton
Reviews.Content: Not close to anything useful except the bus. Room 206 was very small, bed sheets were the only clean thing in the room. Bath room smelt like mould due to the shower being covered in ingrained mould. A towel was placed under the toilet to soak the leaking water. No plug in basin. Lights did not work, some of the globes were actually blown. Tv was new but had no reception, even if it did work you couldn't watch it as it was mounted on the wall which faced another wall! Air-con leaked to another wet patch on the floor even tho it didn't Work. Nothing in the minibar. Windows didn't close properly. Floors were wonky, lift didn't work & staff were not very helpful. Didn't bother with the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute disgrace”
Reviews.Author: pollygon
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hovel at all costs, in this instance the cost was £240 for two of the worst nights sleep I have ever had. Room 210 is a shabby supposidly double room, the bedding looked clean but I soon found out its hidden secret,BEDBUGS! The bed was absolutly covered in them, the '24 hour' conceirge was nowhere to be seen, neither at night or in the morning. I had to wait till 7:30 to phone through my grievances. They 'sorted' it by moving me to another equally shabby room but with a new bed, which leads you to believe that this room,216, had the same problem. I asked what kind of refund of my £120 I would receive but was told it was a common problem in hotels! I could go on, at best this is a 1 * ,flophouse, at worst it is a health hazard that needs closing down. Avoid like the plague, or you might catch it!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you are desperate”
Reviews.Author: chrishead99
Reviews.Content: Good points - Linen, towels & room clean. Bad points – Bed very lumpy, air conditioning did not work, TV reception awful, secondary glazing did not close properly (hotel is on a noisy, busy road) room, mould in shower room, no plug in basin, light switch did not work and light could only be turned on and off using door key. This is a 2 star hotel at best with no concern for resident’s safety as several fire hazards apparent, caused by boxes, broken equipment etc left on stairs and next to lift shafts. Hotel messed up our booking and we finished up with a very small double despite booking a triple room and after much argument got a 10% discount on the original price

Reviews.Title: “Holland Court Hotel is truly a DUMP!!”
Reviews.Author: wwebtvguy
Reviews.Content: I would have thought a minimum requirement for a 3 Star hotel was running water - in the space of our 3 night stay the water went off on no less than four occasions! The room was cramped and filthy, the place had no ventilation and windows that didn't work. At 5pm one evening I was locked out and couldn't raise anyone for about 15 minutes. Forget breakfast, I recommend going hungry rather than the choice of corn flakes and instant powdered coffee. And then they charge for their FREE WIFI internet!! In all of our travels in Europe and the UK from New Zealand, this was the stand out worst accommodation we experienced anywhere. Trust me, give this place a miss!! The Hilton is just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible place”
Reviews.Author: Justus_HH
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is good. Close to Kensigton Olympia tube station. Rooms were small and dirty. Have they ever cleaned those windows. When we arrived to the room, it's window seems to stay open with two empty beer cans. Toilet also dirty and the shower door didn't work. Minibar, yes there only one bottle of juice which was outdated 6 months ago. Continental full breakfast was tea or coffee and juice, muesli, couple of slices toast. With extra price (1£ each) you can get slice of bacon, one sausage, one egg etc. The bar was closed because the bar tender was on vacation. Staff were impolite. Stay far away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Whoever gave the Holland Court a 3* rating is clearly delusional”
Reviews.Author: travelqueenNi
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin...don't stay here if you can help it Our first room was down in the depths of the basement- no daylight getting in due to the blackened out window to disguise the street view, not to mention all the burn marks above all the lights i.e extrembly dodgy electrics! We were granted a new room, 108! Perhaps a slight improvement on the first, but who can say what other problems we would have had with the 1st room! Room 108: The toilet doesnt flush Only take a shower if you dont mind cold water after the early hours, not to mention the clogged drains providing your feet with a delightful sewage treatment if you can't shower in around 2 minutes, before the tray is overspilling with 'water!' 'Delighfully' springy matresses! I think I had company in my bed, if the bites and general itchness the next day were anything to go by! Breakfast: Go to Costa coffee, it may be included in the price but there's nothing traitional or hearty about it! - Everything is cooked in the microwave - Purple tea- I'm acually not kidding, I thought it was a weak hot chocolate! - 'bread' masquerading as toast! Take a chance if you don't value your sanity

Reviews.Title: “A better nights sleep on the tube I expext”
Reviews.Author: TravelmanBasingstoke
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small, and I do mean very small. Could just about manage to walk down the side of the bed to the ultra slim line wardrobe. The mattress on the bed should not be allowed. I am being extremely kind when all I say is it very thin with lots of useless springs that are no longer springs. I cannot imagine these mattresses would of been on the beds when they were very kindly awarded 3, yes.....3 stars!!!!! On the whole my room was clean including the bathroom so I cannot really grumble about that.....the hotel is just in a really poor state and needs a complete makeover but where to start I’m not too sure. The biggest disappointment for me was breakfast. All of it was such poor quality they would be better off not bothering with it. Juice is from a carton, was warm and tasted very sweet and cheap. The coffee was better than the tea which on both occasions I think they forgot to put any tea in the urn’s that they use so when it was stirred together with milk, it ended up being a very weird colour indeed. The FULL ENGLISH BREAKFAST!!!! Well, where do I start. This was the poorest quality breakfast I have had in....well, the poorest quality breakfast ever. Tin tomato....no thank you. Sausage.....looked cheap, tasted cheap, was cheap but hot!! Beans......cold Fried egg......had been cooked a while before it arrived so the yoke had pretty much dried up...NICE!! Bacon.....if I’m honest....that was the best bit of the breakfast, just! Tomato Ketchup......If it says Heinz on the bottle it usually means that Heinz is in the bottle, yeah, Not here. It is red but that is where the resemblance ends. Overall, would I stay again...No Would I recommend...No

Reviews.Title: “Stay away - Should be closed down!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MattGillMattGill
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hovel for a weekend trip to London..........what an absolute nightmare!!! The place is tired and run down with a very poor state of decor and thats just the reception area!! On entering our room (a family room) I was immediately shocked at what lay in wait for us. The room was disgusting, it smelt mouldy, but we soon discovered why, there was water running down the interior wall and mould patches over the carpet. On one wall where the water was running down there was a live plug socket hanging off the wall. The bathroom would not of looked out of place in a squat, it was covered ceiling to floor with mould and dirt I have never seen anything so bad. I had to clean the toilet and bath before it was fit to be used, it hadnt been cleaned from the previous occupants. The paintwork throughout is dirty and chipped and the carpet is a health hazard in itself. Of an evening we could not sleep as the walls are like paper and you can hear everything else going on in the hotel and outside aswell. I cant think of one good thing to say about this place, I'm a firm believer in 'you get what you pay for' but this place should be condemmend, it is an utter disgrace. It also says on the hotel website they have a lounge area to be used whenever, this is not so, its only open for breakfast between 7.30am and 9am. When booking this hotel, just be aware you will not get what you pay for it is a dive!"!!

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain price accomodation”
Reviews.Author: 0traveller0
Reviews.Content: I was quite unsure of the hotel after reading the reviews.. however we were very happy with our room and the service that we had for both nights! We stayed on the 3rd floor in a clean and average size room, breakfast was good and the staff were very helpful. Location was great with the no.9 bus dropping us right into the centre of london 24/7! For £55 per night it was fantastic value!

Reviews.Title: “shocking!”
Reviews.Author: markym00
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe this hole of a hotel. Yes the location is good for the exhibition halls but thats about it. The rest does not deserve the 3 stars it claims to have. Let me list my problems with room 108 1. The mattress was shot to bits. Somebody on here described it as a trampoline which is pretty accurate. You could feel all of the springs and when you sit down it bottoms out on to the bed. 2. The beds itself is falling to pieces. The top of the actual bed was a deep brown colour with some very scary looking stains. The side of the beds was torn so you could see inside. 3. The shower was full of mildew. 3 out of my 4 showers were proper cold. I had 1 luke warm shower, When we complained we were told it was because we were showering too late (7.30am is too late??). Also, 5 minutes after being in the shower the tray was full to the brim. You had to wait a good 10 minutes for the level to fall so you could carry on. 4. The entire building was shabby and in need of a good refurb. 5. Breakfast can only be described as poor. Fruit cocktail out of a tin in syrup. Baked beans that were hard, toast that was still bread etc etc By day 2 I had learnt not to bother with anything other than cereal, beans or egg. 6. during the night the noises that the hotel made were quite funny. rummbles, vibrations and buzzing Reception told us to write to head office for a partial refund. OK, good idea except for the fact that Head office to not reply to emails Have a look at my photos and decide for yourself. If this hotel were 1 star at £55.00 then I would have no issue because you get what you pay for. But 3 stars is just plain rubbish. Good luck to those who stop in room 108

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for..”
Reviews.Author: NortonCaines
Reviews.Content: Stayed here midweek, room small with dated decor, bed very clean (definitely no bugs, but like a trampoline), bathroom small but clean - breakfast adequate. It has free wifi that worked well. This certainly isn't the best hotel in London but I doubt it's the worst. Some of the reviews on here seem a bit over the top. My room cost 55 quid and you can't complain at that price. If you're after bargain basement rooms that are handy for central London then this is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Please dont stay here it should be condemmed.”
Reviews.Author: Covisadump
Reviews.Content: Firstly this is my first review ever, so it must of been very bad!!. We stayed in room 109, felt like room 101. It was tiny you could only walk around the bed on one side, only one light worked and the decor was appaling. The bathroom was the size of a train toilet, the shower had mould everwhere and was a dodgy yellow colour and had a built in foot spa as the drain was knacked. the worst experience was the calamity that was breakfast, either continental buffet which consisted of tepid carton orange juice, a vat of tinned fruit, basket of pepper, basket of salt, basket of tea and a basket of wheatabix, yummy! Or if ya wanted to be really adventureous a full english aka full eastern european, if you manage to place your order as they dont speak english in england anymore you are in for a feast of 1 tasteless sausage, 1 piece of bacon, 1 rubber brown egg, half a tinned tomato and 21 beans, yummy!! Next time you have beans count 21 to see how small a portion it is. If that doesnt fill you up you can buy any item for £1 so i could of got my other half of tomato for 50p but i decided against it. So to sum up please please please please never stay here its revolting, it should be condemed.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Officeangel1
Reviews.Content: The room was small and in need of some TLC. The showerhead was full of limescale and the shower tray was too grubby to even contemplate taking a shower! The TV was positioned on the wall so that you either had to sit on a rather uncomfortable chair about 10ft away, or watch it side-on from the bed.... either way was uncomfortable! Breakfast was poor, with child-sized portions . Customer service was also poor when it came to food service. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and cannot believe I stuck it out for my week-long stay.

Reviews.Title: “I still feel sick!”
Reviews.Author: Diggit77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and have to say was disgusted that they could take my Companies or any other guests money and would advice Environmental Health to take a visit and condemn it! After a long journey to London we arrived late to find a twin room with the beds pushed together- when we tried to move the beds apart the leg fell off one so we needed to do a repair job to fix it. We made a cup of tea to get over the thought that we were going to have to stay in this place, but even found that the Long Life Milk curdled in the cups! The room was unclean with discarded bottles from other visitors still in the room and a very dirty bathroom which was thick with dust and had a yellow stained shower tray! After a very noisy night through vibrating pipes and the sound of someone wretching!! we went for breakfast- with no staff who spoke English it was difficult to even get a bowl for cereals and most of the cutlery and crockery was bent, chipped or unclean. The table was cleaned in front of us with a dirty dishcloth that lef t what can only be described a 'cack' all over the table! This was then cleaned away using a bath towel! At which point I was nearly sick! Looking at the reviews both good and bad here- I feel my skin crawling! We could have picked up anything from there- just one thought to end on!- in the morning who's were those contact lenses discarded above the bed- they hadn't been there the morning before and neither myself or my friend wear them! Lovely- that's right at some point during the day my bed was slept in! AAAHHH!! For you own saftey stay away- there must be a better alternative that doesn't risk your health.

Reviews.Title: “Despair on arrival....”
Reviews.Author: duckparade
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks good from the outside... it even has flags flying proudly, giving it that cosmopolitan feel! Once over the threshold, however, it is a different story. I am writing this review as a warning to other unsuspecting would-be guests.... I don't normally do this review kind of thing! The twin room we had was tiny. The beds were so awful you could play tunes lying on your back by using the protruding springs on the mattresses. There wasn't room to swing a cat! The bathroom basin was touching your nose as you sat on the toilet, the shower tray was yellow and didn't drain away the water (which incidentally was cold!!). Standards of hygiene at breakfast would challenge even the strongest of stomachs and be warned.... scrambled egg is indeed just fried egg chopped up!! Certainly no sign of any Michelin stars for food here! I could go into more detail but the flashbacks are too upsetting. Don't stay here unless you really have to - it's grim!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: jack_demers
Reviews.Content: Was in London for about 5 days. Wanted a cheap hotel but something that was still nice and cozy. Holland Court hotel is just that. Clean rooms, mini bar, wi-fi internet access, restaurant downstairs and great service. Real close to the tube, easy to get to from Heathrow... really can't go wrong with this place. And the price for this value is as good if not better than any place we've stayed at. Definetly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “3-star hotel, 4-star quality, 2-star pricing.”
Reviews.Author: johnnygunara
Reviews.Content: This place is a hidden gem. Only 38mins from Heathrow (straight on the picadily line), nice bar/restuarant downstairs (open 24/7!!), good sized room, and really classy feel. Me and my friends were on a tight budget and after staying at another hotel earlier in our trip, we checked out this place after hearing great things from some family who had stayed here. At this price with this quality, would definitely come back with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, but not impressed by the staff!”
Reviews.Author: rozzle89
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for 2 nights at Holland Court and we got a good deal, with English breakfast included each morning of our stay. The rooms were nice, bathroom was a little small but was okay for a couple of days. It was a good location too, with the nearest tube station a 2-minute walk away and bus stops around 30 seconds up the road. The only thing that didn't impress us was the staff - upon arrival we were told our room number and nothing else! Had to ask about breakfast arrangements, check-out times, etc etc, all things that you would usually be told upon arrival. The breakfast staff were friendly but spoke poor english so it was difficult for us to order what we wanted. When checking out we also asked about the supposed 'luggage room' as we were heading out for the day and needed to leave our luggage in a safe place. We were told to 'just leave it in the corner of reception' - our luggage was not labelled or identity secured in any way, and upon coming back to retrieve it we found that it was exactly where we left it, it had not been secured in the luggage room. Also when we collected it we were not asked for any ID or to sign anything, we just turned up and got it, so anybody could have gotten away with our luggage! Overall, a good value stay but don't expect much from the staff, and avoid leaving your luggage there once you check out!

Reviews.Title: “do not stay at this awful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wickedbeau
Reviews.Content: my partner and i are both students and so wanted a cheap place to stay on our visit to London. We weren't fussed about a grand hotel, just somewhere clean to rest our heads. The hotel's location is alright, it's very near the tube- this is perhaps its only redeeming feature. Firstly we arrived at the hotel to be grunted at by the receptionist. Our room was o.k (at first). the bathroom was ok, mould everywhere. but the beds were clean. we tried to turn the tv on- it didnt work. it was hot so we turned the air con on when mouldy water began dripping down the walls into the tv and the hair dryer below. We ran to the reception as were we worried about the possible hazzards with electricity. The receptionist didn't care what so ever. when asked to speak to a manager she said no. when i asked for his name she shrugged. when i asked how i would dry my hair or plug in my other appliances she shrugged and finally said we could check out if we didn't like it. This was said in a threatening manner and being visitors we knew we would have to stick in this grotty hotel as we didn't know what else to do. She promised a maintainence man would sort it out, when we returned that night the new guy on reception said she had not even filed a complaint and knew nothing about the water pouring down the wall. he promised we would get another room the next day. the same horrid lady rang the next day to say we had another room, we re-packed and came into reception to be told we had to wait two hours for our room. this person was clearly taking the mick, and she was enjoying it! we left our cases and had a fun day in london and returned to a new room which was two singles instead of a double, the view from the window was what looked like a piece of opaque plastic! the air con in the room dripped not inside our room but on the outside instead! There was towels on the floor outside from all the water, which is very dangerous and worried us quite abit. we could not wait to leave. Our stay wouldn't have been so bloody awful had the receptionist said sorry, shown some sign of compassion or empathy for her fellow man! If someone inspected this hotel i have no doubt that it would get shut down. not safe at all. as we left we saw some other people complaining in the reception. they probably were put in our old room. no, actually i think all the rooms were no doubt just as hideous as ours. what a romance killer! never again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not cheerful”
Reviews.Author: PURPLECOUPLE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel because it is near Hammersmith Apollo. The hotel was ideal for us because we just needed a place to put our heads down, and it was a very reasonable price. On arrival we were greeted with a grunt and a tut from the receptionist. Our room was basic to say the least, and very small. The condition of the room wasn't brilliant, mould in the shower, only one light working, cracks in the walls. The bedding and the room was clean. Breakfast was nice but small and served on cold plates. It's the sort of place where you would stay just to put your head down for one night only.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable for business purpose!”
Reviews.Author: Maria_Noel
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting at Earl's Court Exhibition for the show Civil Service Live, and the nearest Hotel was Holland Court Hotel or Hilton Hotel. Just compare the prices between this 2 hotels and I just went for the cheapest as my budget was low. This hotel has everything what I need: Wireless and a small dining room where my colleague and I stayed to have a small meeting before the show. Room was fine, not very big but big enough for myself. The next morning, i went to go early to catch my taxi around 6.30am and I have requested the night before to have a small breakfast if possible before i leave and I did get it. Friendly staff and comfortable, this is all I want to have for my trip in London for the show. Will certainly recommand.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Golfnut57
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were given room 215 which was extremely small. When we asked for a bigger room, the only one available was a "suite" which was a similar size to a double room in any other hotel, and we were charged extra per night. We reluctantly took it and shortly after, we discovered that the TV had no remote control although reception insisted that there should be as he checked the room himself, and try as we may, we could not operate it with out one. On reporting it to reception, I was told that it would be replaced the following morning. We didn't hear any more about it! The decor in the bathroom was very shabby, the paint was peeling off the ceiling and the standard of tiling etc. was very poor to say the least. The information booklet in the room said the hotel had a bar open 24 hours a day and on returning to the hotel, tired and exhausted after visting Wimbledon at around 10.30pm, we were told by a very unfriendly member of staff that the bar was closed. The only good thing about this hotel was the breakfast, although if you required anything extra ie. more toast etc. there was a charge of £1 per item. All in all, an awful hotel with very unfriendly reception staff, and would love to know how this possibly could have obtained a 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good position and good service!”
Reviews.Author: TomandRascal
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel in December 2006. The location is good, the staff friendly and they served English breakfast. Next time I 'll go back to london , I'll probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a khazi”
Reviews.Author: pottymouth61
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. Moronic staff, roaches in the bathroom, shower disfunctional, non-english speaking waitress, dirty bedclothes, telly didn't work and only slightly cheaper than the K west up the road or the Hilton 100m away (on company rates). I sometimes have to stay there but each time I dread the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comparing price and quality, it is good value”
Reviews.Author: brenorg
Reviews.Content: Location is good, a stone throw away from High street Kensington and from Olympia station which takes you to Earls court from where you have to change train to reach other destinations. If you're going by tube, don't stop at Earls court station since with baggage, it's a long way, but stop at Olympia which is only 5 minutes walk away. Arriving at the hotel, the staff is nice and helpfull. However if you're looking for a spacious room this is not the place to go since rooms are very small and with the baggage in a twin room, we could hardly walk. Rooms were clean and tidy and everything was explained. The bathroom is small too and need some refurbishment but everything works well. One thing that bothered me was that the light couldnt be switched from the bed since the switch didn't worked in both rooms, since I had booked two rooms since there wasn't full availibility in the same room for my whole stay. Breakfast was good and staff is very nice, always ready to help you. Even tough the english breakfast is plated and not a buffet, the portion is reasonable. Wi-fi is also available. For what I've paid, I think that its good value for money, clean and well located with a helpfull staff and near to a prominent road where you can cater for all your needs.

Reviews.Title: “loved every minute of it, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: TaniaFarr
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned before I went to this hotel as most of the reviews were not that good. However my opinion changed. The staff are very welcome and friendly. Breakfast was included in the very low price we paid. I can say that it was what we expected and will surely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK budget alternative”
Reviews.Author: hanspfo
Reviews.Content: After reading the negative reviews, I was a bit worried before my three nights stay at the hotel. Anyway, my room (2nd floor facing the street) was clean and seemed well kept. The bathroom and shower worked well too, and although a bit tiny the room itself would be OK for two persons. The small TV was crappy, but as the hotel has free Wi-Fi I didn't mind. In my room it wasn't possible to switch the light off when in bed, which was a bit annoying. The room's water boiler looked somewhat unsafe, but worked without starting any fires... The rate also included a simple English breakfast. Considering the price for the room, I think Holland Court Hotel is an OK budget alternative for those of you not planning to spend time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: stratfordmary
Reviews.Content: We pre-booked two double rooms in this hotel to attend my sons wedding. When we arrived the rooms were so disgusting my daughter and her husband refused to stay and checked out. The receptionist appeared to accept their complaints that the room was dirty and the bathrooms were virtually unuseable and covered in mould. The mattresses were dirty and stained. When we checked out they charged us on our credit card for both rooms for two nights and refused to discuss the matter - the manager was "unavailable". We wrote to complain but did not even receive the courtesy of a reply. Avoid this hotel it is revolting you would be better off in a youth hostel. The place makes your skin creep.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: lilyanddaisy
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel and reading reviews I was very concerned . The room was clean and big enough only thing I would say is the bathroom needs tiles on walls and floor replacing. It was in quiet area and close to tube station.

Reviews.Title: “GIVE THIS HOTEL A MISS !”
Reviews.Author: SYLMARK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in June. Booked 2 double rooms and both were tiny and not very clean. Not even enough room to walk round the bed. Staff spoke little English- so no joy on reception! The 24hr bar was closed on Saturday at 11pm- told to use the mini-bar. The breakfast which was supposed to be included had a supplement of £5 for a tiny cooked breakfast. Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Be wary of booking here”
Reviews.Author: jfmsh
Reviews.Content: We have booked here twice. The first occasion (April, '08) was satisfactory, average in all categories, for the price. The second was for our son's wedding nearby, in which we had a key organisational role. The booking for 3 nights (early July '08) was made 2 months in advance, and PREPAID. With 2 weeks to go an e-mail was received cancelling the booking, and returning payment on credit card. Likewise a booking for family friends made at same time as ours. Reason? -- urgent refurbishment. Phoned hotel, but couldn't get past reception, who were unhelpful, and their explanation unconvincing. Spent worrying few days trying to arrange alternative at short notice (LateRooms very helpful here). Have never encountered such disgraceful behaviour from a British hotel before, and advise anyone thinking of booking here to consider carefully. Is this operation basically unreliable?

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Traveler33487
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned about staying in this hotel after booking it and reading the reviews. But, the price was good, and the area was in a good neighborhood. Yes, the rooms are small, but we were going to London to see the sights, not a hotel room. The beds were a bit old, but servicable. There was a private bathroom in the room (no walking down a hall or anything), and there were always clean towels and sheets waiting for us at the end of the day. The staff left a bit to be desired, but you cannot beat the location or the price. Olympia Underground is a short 4 minute walk, High Street Kensington is about a 10 minute pleasant walk. The Crown and Sceptre across the street was the best. Every night after our wandering, we would go there for a pint and to review our day. Great food, warm atmosphere and the barkeeps ended up knowing us by the time we left. All in all, it is NOT the Hilton in Miami Beach, but it was quant, clean and most of all convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Death Trap”
Reviews.Author: NewportRose
Reviews.Content: This is my first review I have ever felt the need to write. Three welsh ladies visiting king tuts exhibit, and show. We booked the triple room for two nights, our first impression was good. Except the young lady demanded to see the my card, plus my passport. I actually felt like a foreigner in my own country. We were directed to the small lift, our room was in the basement of the building. I actually needed a stiff drink to sleep in this room. I felt like if a fire happened there was no way out!!! I personally dreaded going back to hotel, ruined our stay. We expressed our concerns to the lady on the reception who explained there was no other rooms available at that price. The room was large with two double beds and one put me up. Although the sheets were clean, the bedhead and covers grubby, net curtains black covering the bars on the windows. Bathroom clean. The whole room was in need of updating, everything looked tired, scruffy. I am unable to recommend the use of this hotel for one night even. Full English Breakfast was £5 extra Oh, and by the way they need to use proper tea. More like dishwater. On departure we advised the young lady at the desk of our dissatisfaction. Our weekend however in London was splendid. The Tower of London, plus the Portabella Market well worth a visit too.

Reviews.Title: “Stay far away”
Reviews.Author: Orls2
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms in this 'hotel' for four people. Luckily only 3 came. 1st impressions - the reception area was nice. My sister's room was a single room semi- converted to pretending to be a double. There was no room to swing a mouse let alone a cat. the room was old and the bedding obviously very old and the rubber mattress - I'll say no more. When we originally booked in at reception she was told that she would be moved after 2 nights to a much larger family room, she decided to 'put up' with it till then. We were staying for 5 nights. My room consisted of twin beds, in the basement which was quite. Unfortunately the window was Jared open. When I spoke with reception the next day, the gentleman was amazing at my problem - as they had only got new windows in within the last 6 months- when I spoke with the girl at reception for the 2/3 time (who really should be working at back of house - no people skills), after been assured that the 'handyman' would be back sometime! Eventually I was told that it was an ongoing problem and couldnt be fixed, I pointed out that it was October and cold and there was a child in the room. I was told the hotel was full and there wasnt anything she could/would do. The second room my sister got was bigger but the spring on the thin mattress kept sticking up. Obviously would not recommend this hotel under any circumstances as a regular visitor to London I understand that the standard is not very high but this place is a new very low

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever”
Reviews.Author: ale52
Reviews.Content: STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL. Dear Readers, I have been recently there after having booked for three nights. At the check-in, without notice they charged my credit cards in full for three nights. I did not even signed the card receipt ( the bill says : customer not present!) Their policy says that the room is £ 95.00 tax included. Lies, the tax is excluded and charged to my credit card. When we finally enter the room, badly smelling of humidity, we found the sheets dirty and sigarettes hole on the covers. All upsholsery dirty by spots, a real not even one star hotel! We have been forced to move somewhere else. I asked a refund of at least the other two nights. They denied. Their policy says : Reservations made within 48 hours of the day of your arrival may not be modified or cancelled or the first night's accommodation will become payable and will be charged to your debit or credit card used to guarantee your reservation. In spite of their cancellation policy THEY DID NOT REFUND TWO NIGHTS! VERY UNRELIABLE PEOPLE BE AWARE! BE AWARE! BE AWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Stay AWAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorker30
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I ever stayed in! I don't know why it has a 3 star rating but it's much closer to 0 or .5 stars. As you walk in there is a horrible smell that's a mixture between garbage, mildew or sewer which lingered for the entire 3 nights we stayed there. When we got to our rooms, the beds weren't even made from the previous guests which was a horrible first impression and entirely unexceptable. By the time they prepared the room, my pillow had gross stains on it and the blanket had cigarette burns and tears in it. The blanket was so old and dingy that I didn't even want it to touch me. This hotel is not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Clean, Comfortable and Convenient -”
Reviews.Author: slj60
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business while attending an exhibition at Olympia which is literally a five minute walk from the hotel. I booked directly with the hotel and got a double room for £70 per night including cooked breakfast. The hotel is very clean and comfortable and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. I cannot believe the review posted in December that the staff did not speak english - their english is perfect and most of them have been working at the hotel for several years. Many of the other guests were repeat visitors. The rooms are very well equipped and comfortable. Mini bar/fridge, tea and coffee making facilities, free WIFI access, an electric fan, toiletries and ample towels, Iron and ironing board, trouser press and everything you would expect in a top london hotel. The only negative thing I would say about the hotel is the size of the bedrooms, which is why I have not given this hotel an excellent rating. I asked for a room over looking the garden and was given one. However it was very small for a double room for two people and as there were two of us I asked if we could have a larger room. We were given one on the front of the hotel, (it really wasn't that noisy as we only slept there) The room was bigger than the garden room but the rooms at this hotel are small with one side of the bed up against the wall. However as before it was very clean and comfortable and the free WIFI and facilities in the room were excellent. The showers in both the rooms we stayed in were really powerful Grohe showers which was great. While checking out I did notice they have a suite for £125 per night which the lovely girl on reception said was much bigger than the bedrooms. Breakfast was cooked to order and there was a selection of cereals, fruit juice and fruit salad. The location is superb, just round the corner from Olympia and walking distance to Kensington High Street which has some good restaurants. I would recomment this hotel for value for money and location. It is charming and cosy and very clean. Last year I stayed at the Kensington Hilton, which is just up the road and had the most dreadful room with furniture falling apart and a leaking ceiling. It cost over double what I paid at Holland Court. I think you would be hard pushed to find a hotel in central london that offers all the facilities and service this hotel does for £70 per room per night bed and breakfast. There are also family rooms available and I would stay here with my kids if we came to London in the Summer holidays. Well done to all the staff at this hotel and thank you for an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed at!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ursulajones
Reviews.Content: I don't normally take the time to write reviews and when I do they're normally positive...but I felt compelled to warn people about how goddamn awful this place is. Where do I start... My wife and I booked via Expedia and thought for the price this place was a steal....boy were we wrong...there were mice in the dining room...the toilet was covered in urine stains from the previous guest(s) and stains on the bed sheets!!! When we tried to complain the manager...a guy who barely spoke English ignored our claims and had the cheek to say we'd made the mess. do yourselves a favour and avoid this place

HotelInfo.Name: Holland Court Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 31 - 33 Holland Road, Kensington Olympia, London W14 8HJ, England
